solution_line_template: She bought {chicken_pounds} pounds of chicken for ${chicken_price_per_pound}/pound so that's {chicken_pounds}*${chicken_price_per_pound} = $<<{chicken_pounds}*{chicken_price_per_pound}={chicken_cost}>>{chicken_cost}

She bought {num_sweet_potatoes} sweet potatoes at ${sweet_potato_price_each} each so that's {num_sweet_potatoes}*${sweet_potato_price_each} = $<<{num_sweet_potatoes}*{sweet_potato_price_each}={sweet_potatoes_cost}>>{sweet_potatoes_cost}

She bought {num_broccoli_heads} heads of broccoli for ${broccoli_price_each} each so that's {num_broccoli_heads}*${broccoli_price_each} = $<<{num_broccoli_heads}*{broccoli_price_each}={broccoli_cost}>>{broccoli_cost}

The chicken is ${chicken_cost}, lettuce is ${lettuce_cost}, tomatoes are ${cherry_tomatoes_cost}, the sweet potatoes are ${sweet_potatoes_cost}, broccoli is ${broccoli_cost} and Brussel sprouts are ${brussel_sprouts_cost} for a total of ${chicken_cost} + ${lettuce_cost} + ${cherry_tomatoes_cost} + ${sweet_potatoes_cost} + ${broccoli_cost} + ${brussel_sprouts_cost} = $<<{chicken_cost}+{lettuce_cost}+{cherry_tomatoes_cost}+{sweet_potatoes_cost}+{broccoli_cost}+{brussel_sprouts_cost}={current_cart_total}>>{current_cart_total}

To get free delivery she needs to spend ${free_delivery_minimum}, and she already has ${current_cart_total} in her cart, so she needs to spend an extra ${free_delivery_minimum}-${current_cart_total} = $<<{free_delivery_minimum}-{current_cart_total}={additional_spend_needed}>>{additional_spend_needed}
